reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on the way to the glaciers. Very isolated, rural setting. Stayed in a A-frame chalet. The chalet was comfortable but very warm after being in the mid-summer sun, but soon cooled down overnight. There is no phone coverage between Wanaka and West Coast, fortunately the centre has wifi available for a very reasonable price. The food in the pub/restaurant was good, and reasonable value considering the location.
reviews.title: Good place for a one night stopover

reviews.text: Last July, were were travelling down the West Coast of the South Island, and had Pre-booked a Night's stay at the Makarora Tourist Centre. We had been travelling all day, and arrived at the Tourist Centre after dark. The Office was closed, but a Map and a Sign with our Name on it left on the front door soon drew attention to where our chalet was located.
reviews.title: Our Makarora Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were easily able to find the Chalet, and were delighted to find that the Lights and Heating had all been turned on by the staff beforehand so as to welcome us. And, as this was in the middle of Winter, and had been snowing previously, this was great to find. We found everything we needed in the chalet, with plenty of room and Hot Water. In the morning before We left we were able to gas up the car at their Pumps, and pay for the accomodation. We found the Staff to be friendly and helpful, as they opened the Pumps early for us specially.
reviews.title: great for a nights stay.
Nice enough for a night stop

reviews.text: we got here mid evening, found our room, went to the bar and had an enjoyable drink. the toilets were separate from the rooms (your own triangular building!) but they did a good job of keeping them clean and bug free (until morning!) it was a nice enough stay for a passing through nights kip.
reviews.title: Ok, for overnighter
